messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Amy
messages.msgSnippet: OK, guys, I m blushing. You must come clean with the reality about these book reviews! Thanks for intro-ing me. It was by far the easiest one I ve ever done.
messages.messageBody:
OK, guys, I'm blushing. You must come clean with the reality about these
book reviews!
Thanks for intro-ing me. It was by far the easiest one I've ever done.
Amy




~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Peace is Patriotic
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

messages.messageBody:
> I think she should post a page of book reviews there too. :-)
>
yes, amy's reviews of books are just super. and she also have neat ideas
for organizing craft stuff and such. I was so impressed to see how
organized her kids' arts and crafts area is. and her kids are pretty
fantastic, too:)

dawn h-s

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Amy
messages.msgSnippet: On Thu, 8 Nov 2001 12:52:52 -0500 A. Scott  ... This is my friend Amy, mother to Benjamin the Benevolent and Brave, and Jeremiah the
messages.messageBody:
On Thu, 8 Nov 2001 12:52:52 -0500 "A. Scott" <info@...>
writes:
> > And Amy, have you been here all along? I didn't realize that...cool.
>
> :-) About a month I think. I guess I ought to post an intro?

This is my friend Amy, mother to Benjamin the Benevolent and Brave, and
Jeremiah the Just Plain Wonderful. She is famed throughout the internet
for her capsule reviews of storybooks, posted to lucky readers at erratic
intervals. She does other cool stuff at http://www.wearsthebaby.com, and
I think she should post a page of book reviews there too. :-)

How's that?

Dar
